definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: we have the best public transportation that there is.
sentences.chinese: 我们有最好的公共交通。

sentences.english: We will continue giving priority to the development of urban public transport systems.
sentences.chinese: 坚持优先发展城市公共交通。

sentences.english: Do you find the public transportation in LA reliable?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得洛杉矶的公共交通可靠吗？

sentences.english: What do you think of the public transportation in LA?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么看待洛杉矶的公共交通？

sentences.english: But they have really had a big scaling down of the mass transit system this year.
sentences.chinese: 但是今年确实大幅度削减了公共交通。

sentences.english: The public transpiration took a large proportion of service, including Metro.
sentences.chinese: 公共交通包括地铁也有一定比率的服务。

sentences.english: So secondly more special bus lines for public transportation should be added.
sentences.chinese: 因此，第二，更多的公共交通专用公交线路。

sentences.english: is that they're cutting the public sector, which I think is a very bad move.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在削减公共交通，我认为这是一个很糟的举动。

sentences.english: Can you tell us about the public transportation in New York City?
sentences.chinese: 你能跟我们讲讲纽约市的公共交通吗？

sentences.english: There is a light railway in the city, which is one of the main public transportation.
sentences.chinese: 市内有一条轻轨铁路，这是市内主要的公共交通之一。

sentences.english: It is located at ground floor near the public transport terminus and is accessible from Yi Nam Road.
sentences.chinese: 位于地下近公共交通总站，可由怡南路前往。

sentences.english: Mass transit reduces traffic congestion and the pollution it generates.
sentences.chinese: 公共交通减少了交通拥挤和由此产生的污染。

sentences.english: It is foundation of public transit networks optimization that is demand forecast of public transit.
sentences.chinese: 公共交通需求预测是公交线网优化的基础。

sentences.english: For another, it saves time. As public transportation is overburdened.
sentences.chinese: 一方面，它减轻了过度拥挤的公共交通的重负。

sentences.english: Right now the Oyster Card is only used on public transport and there is little Internet functionality available.
sentences.chinese: 现在，牡蛎卡只用于公共交通，其网络功用几乎为零。

sentences.english: The selection of the optimal station position for the planning of the public transportation network is studied in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 文章研究公共交通网络规划中的最优设站问题。

definition: public transportation/mass transit/abbr. for 公共交通[gong1 gong4 jiao1 tong1]
light rail/transit system (underground, at street level or elevated)/streetcar/metro/abbr. for 輕型軌道交通|轻型轨道交通[qing1 xing2 gui3 dao4 jiao1 tong1]
to go out somewhere (relatively short trip)/to set off on a journey (longer trip)
to ride (in a car or carriage)/to drive/to motor
to change train (plane, bus etc)/transfer between modes of transport
